Package ohos.multimodalinput.event

Class TouchEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.multimodalinput.event.MultimodalEvent
      • ohos.multimodalinput.event.ManipulationEvent
        • ohos.multimodalinput.event.TouchEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public abstract class TouchEvent
extends ManipulationEvent
    Defines touch events and mapped standard events.

    Information about a touch event includes the finger positions in multi-finger touch, touch pressure, and touch radius. A standard event is used to indicate the user intent. Its definition is irrelevant of the input device type. The system maps a basic interaction event of another type of input to a standard interaction event of a touch input. The mapping is as follows: For basic mouse interaction events:

    • Clicking and holding the left button on the mouse maps to touching the screen with a finger at the pointer position, as described in PRIMARY_POINT_DOWN.
    • Clicking and holding the left button on the mouse and then moving the pointer maps to touching the screen and moving the finger on the screen, as described in POINT_MOVE.
    • Releasing the left button on the mouse maps to lifting up a finger from the screen, as described in PRIMARY_POINT_UP.
    Note: The touchscreen does not have a hover pointer state. Therefore, if the mouse is moved without any button pressed, no interaction event is mapped to the touchscreen. To map to this mouse input event, this class defines the hover states for the pointer, such as HOVER_POINTER_ENTER, HOVER_POINTER_MOVE, and HOVER_POINTER_EXIT. For basic stylus interaction events:
    • Touching the screen with the stylus pen tip maps to touching the screen with a finger, as described in PRIMARY_POINT_DOWN.
    • Touching the screen with the stylus pen tip and then moving on the screen maps to touching the screen and moving the finger on the screen, as described in POINT_MOVE.
    • Lifting up the stylus from the screen maps to lifting up a finger from the screen, as described in PRIMARY_POINT_UP.
    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    ManipulationEvent, MouseEvent, StylusEvent
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.MultimodalInput#MULTIMODAL_INPUT

    • Method Detail

      • getMultimodalEvent

        public MultimodalEvent getMultimodalEvent​()
        Obtains the original multimodal input event that has been mapped to a standard interaction event.

        After an original multimodal input event is mapped to a standard interaction event, you can call this method to obtain the original event. For example, after a mouse event is mapped to a touch event, this method returns the mouse event.

        Returns:
        Returns the original event.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        MultimodalEvent

      • getAction

        public abstract int getAction​()
        Obtains the current pointer action status.
        Returns:
        Returns the current pointer action status. The return value can be PRIMARY_POINT_DOWN, PRIMARY_POINT_UP, POINT_MOVE, OTHER_POINT_DOWN, or OTHER_POINT_UP.
        Since:
        1

      • getIndex

        public abstract int getIndex​()
        Obtains the index of the pointer action.

        This method obtains the pointer index of the pointer action, for example, OTHER_POINT_DOWN or OTHER_POINT_UP. Based on the index, you can obtain information such as the touch pressure and touch radius.

        Returns:
        Returns the index of the pointer action, which is in the range from 0 to ManipulationEvent#getPointerCount()-1.
        Since:
        1
